intro: Acosta brachtii, commonly known as the golden cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces a fruit that resembles a cupuaçu but has a distinct golden hue and a unique flavor profile. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological studies and potential commercial use. Acosta brachtii thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
